intro: Lepismium micranthum, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, which open at night. It has a compact growth habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Lepismium micranthum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique nocturnal blooming pattern.
